alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:52PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Franklin, Hart, west central Anderson and southeastern Oconee Counties through 515 PM EST... At 452 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Commerce, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Carnesville, Royston, Reed Creek, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville and Tugaloo State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
